--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Colin Green <cgreen@d...> wrote:

> As I recall Derek and Philip's image recognition work uses an
egocentric 
> eye and this makes sense to me since the same pattern in different 
> rotations only needs to be learned once, which then leads me to ask
if 
> an egocentric eye was used, or has been tried at playing Go. I
don't 
> think the eye in your paper used rotation did it Ken? Not to mention
the 
> zooming function which may or may not be useful depending on the
type of 
> board game.
> 

My roving eye actually was able to rotate by 90 degree increments. 
However, it could not zoom, as you note.  

For robot/agent control domains like prey capture, I think the best
kinds of sensors are rangefinders or radars, like in my robot duel
work.

ken
